action.action-desc: Mr. Lamborn (for himself, Mr. Vargas, Mr. Kustoff, Mr. Zeldin, Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Mr. Chabot, Mr. Gohmert, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mrs. Hartzler, and Mr. Bacon) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To deter foreign financial institutions from providing banking services for the benefit of foreign terrorist organizations and from facilitating or promoting payments for acts of terrorism.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Taylor Force Martyr Payment Prevention Act of 2022.

paragraph.text: Banks in nominally friendly jurisdictions evade United States anti-terrorism sanctions by avoiding an official presence in the United States, and continue to knowingly provide banking services, including dollar-denominated transactions, for terrorist organizations that target United States nationals for murder.
Such flouting of anti-terrorism financial regulations is only possible through the maintenance or use of correspondent accounts at United States banks for the benefit of terrorist organizations.

subsection.text: It is the sense of Congress that under authority granted by section 5318A of title 31, United States Code, as amended by section 3, the Secretary of the Treasury should—

paragraph.text: find foreign financial institutions that flout anti-terrorism financial regulations to be of primary money laundering concern; and
prohibit the maintenance or use of correspondent accounts in the United States by such institutions.

section.header: Consideration of facilitation of terrorism in designating institutions, accounts, and transactions as of primary money laundering concern
section.text: Section 5318A(c)(2)(B) of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking all 3 and inserting all of the preceding;
in clause (ii), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in clause (iii), by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: notwithstanding clause (ii), the extent to which such institutions knowingly provide, or cause other financial institutions to provide, financial services (including personal banking services) to the entity described in subsection (a) of section 594.319 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation), or persons described in subsection (b) of that section; and

the extent to which such institutions, transactions, or types of accounts are used to facilitate or promote payments for acts of terrorism described in section 1004(a)(1)(B) of the Taylor Force Act (22 U.S.C. 2378c–1(a)(1)(B)).
